sect1.title: Connectivity-Devices
sect1.para: The network topologies above can use several types of connectivity devices. Some are required (such as hubs for star networks) and othes provide optional features; for example, a repeater can extend the length of a bus network segment.
Repeaters Connects network segments to extend total length.
Hub Connects nodes to a central points in a star topolgy.
Switch Connects nodes to a central points in a star topolgy: sends packets to nodes based on MAC address.
Bridge Filters and moves data between segments based on MAC address.
Router Filters and moves data between segments based on logical address.
Brouter Combines bridge and router capablities.
Gateway Translates between protocols and data formats.
